page.title: 08East Hartley Farm
page.content: We went to{East Hartley}Farm.The farm belongs to Mr and Mrs Bendell.The farm is{Dairy and Arable.They have 130 {acres}which is mostly{grass and corn} {and 30 acres of woodland.}They have 20 fields.They grow barley,stubble turnips and grass.They keep cows and bullocks.There are two people to run the farm. The{farmhouse is part {Saxon.}In the yard are some disused stables which made a Hay shed but unfortunately they could not keep the roof on.the Bendells have owned the farm since 1969.Their means of transport is a car and a van.Their nearest shopping town is Kingbridge. Mrs Bendell takes in visitors in the summer.They have{beehives}and{3/4} {acres conservation area}which is covered in gorse and brambles with {badgers}who run wild and live in sets .And they keep{bees.}
